content.description: A school that does not have air conditioning has published a policy to close school when the outside temperature reaches or exceeds 95Â°F. The following code segment is intended to print a message indicating whether or not the school is open, based on the temperature. Assume that the variable degrees has been properly declared and initialized with the outside temperature.
content.question: if (degrees > 95){System.out.println("School will be closed due to extreme heat");}else{System.out.println("School is open");}Which of the following initializations for degrees, if any, will demonstrate that the code segment may not work as intended?

choices.label: The code will work as intended for all values of degrees.

skill.text: 3.D: Explain why a code segment will not compile or work as intended and modify the code to correct the error.
